question.title: Will Ofcom publish at least one enforcement decision under the UK Online Safety Act that includes a monetary penalty amount?
question.description:
Early monetary penalties under the Online Safety framework would signal enforcement intensity and compliance risk for platforms operating in the UK.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"61d27607dc980762","sheet_id":178.1}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves “Yes” if, after the time the question opens and before May 1, 2026, Ofcom publishes a public enforcement outcome under the Online Safety Act (or explicitly under Online Safety enforcement) that states a monetary penalty amount (a fine), and “No” otherwise. The primary source is Ofcom’s Enforcement page, which can be filtered to Online safety: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/enforcement. A qualifying publication must explicitly state that a monetary penalty/financial penalty/fine has been imposed and must specify an amount.
question.fine_print: Ensure "topic" is set to Online Safety. Do not count non-monetary actions such as opening an investigation, issuing information requests, publishing guidance, or announcing an enforcement programme unless a monetary penalty amount is stated. If multiple penalties are announced in a single publication, the question still resolves “Yes.” If the primary source is unavailable, the question may resolve using the Metaculus credible-sources policy at https://www.metaculus.com/faq/.
